Increased sales through effective customer communication.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Account Director

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
**Fully remote position for Eastern and Central time zones.**
The Account Director (AD) assumes a pivotal role in upholding client stability and shaping their potential for growth. 
As the lead in day-to-day client engagement, the AD crafts strategic recommendations tailored to address the client's business challenges within the marketing and consumer landscape. Directing a team of agency professionals, the AD ensures client needs are met while driving favorable outcomes that bolster agency profitability and overall financial well-being. Collaborating with internal specialists, the AD guides clients toward innovative marketing solutions, enriching their operational and planning processes.
Key AccountabilitiesClient communicationTeam managementAccount planning and resource management / forecasting
Core DutiesResponsible for guaranteeing client satisfaction and handling strategic challenges or problem resolution of one-to-one marketing issuesObtain a comprehensive understanding of the marketplace and our clients’ businesses including various media and distribution channelsProactive engagement with client to evolve and improve existing services, in order to drive profitabilityGuarantee and be held accountable for the security of our client’s businessManage and ensure quality of our services to clientsManagement and handling of key client briefs, projects and requests, including the refinement of the aboveStandard day-to-day management of clients and their requests including presentations, documentation, and client activity administrationEnsure the excellence of projects; effectively manage and interpret client feedback; Guide Brand Executives to implement projects smoothly and effectivelySupport Brand Executives in developing new business or expanding existing businessFinancial control of billings and third party costsWrite/proofread major communications materials including executive internal memos, executive speeches, Q&A, sensitive topic statements, pitch docs or press releasesMaintain high-level contacts within business and industry relationsSpearhead significant offline activities and events while maintaining high standardsOffer strategic guidance and support to key clients during account planningAdvise clients on crafting effective customer management strategiesLead the development of communication plans and PR strategies with the teamStay current on industry trends crucial for the organization's sustainability and competitivenessAdapt proposals to suit evolving business landscapesFacilitate effective client briefs for internal teams, including strategy, creative, and deliveryEnsure the quality of creative outputs in collaboration with the Creative DirectorFoster motivation and streamline working processes within the creative teamSupervise project briefings and secure client approvalDeliver constructive creative feedbackDevelop strong working relationships with Brand Executives to ensure that once briefed the campaign/project moves forward smoothlyBe the initial contact for resolving problems raised by Brand ExecutiveWork with President to project future account team personnel requirements and overcome any existing challengesDemonstrate proactive and energetic working attitudeTake responsibility for management and motivation of account team members to allow them to achieve maximum potentialAbide by the Creative Energy policy manual 
Qualifications6+ years of creative agency account management experienceTeam-leading experienceExcellent writing skills, strong presentation capabilities (proven media relations skills)Strong verbal and presentation skills with the ability to speak knowledgeably with high level executives internally and with clientsDetail-oriented, organized and dedicated; proactive and enthusiastic with an ability to juggle multiple tasks and meet deadlines; a quick learnerKnowledge of working software (Office 365, Google Docs, etc.)

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
